title.value: Exploring the digital divide: results of a survey informing mobile application development
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the provided text and encapsulates the core focus of the paper.
title.quote: Exploring the digital divide: results of a survey informing mobile application development

extractions.description: This paper explores the digital divide, specifically focusing on the challenges it poses for the development of inclusive mobile health applications. It presents results from a survey conducted among caregivers of pediatric patients to understand internet and smartphone access, familiarity, and readiness to use mobile health apps.

type.justification: The research is based on a survey conducted among caregivers, collecting data regarding their digital access and familiarity to understand the digital divide.
type.quote: A cross-sectional survey was conducted at the Montreal Children’s Hospital (MCH), an urban tertiary pediatric hospital that serves a multicultural population.

name.justification: The focus is on mobile health applications and overcoming digital barriers in healthcare, which falls under the domain of digital health.
name.quote: Mobile health apps risk widening health disparities if they overlook digital inclusion...

name.justification: The research involves remote patient contact and the use of technology to improve healthcare, which are key aspects of telemedicine.
name.quote: Mobile health applications (“apps”) are gaining popularity for patient services due to their practicality in enabling remote patient contact...

name.justification: The paper discusses addressing the digital divide to promote equitable healthcare outcomes, aligning with the health equity field.
name.quote: By prioritizing inclusivity, mobile health innovations can effectively address the diverse needs of users and promote equitable healthcare outcomes.
